subject: Productivity
title: Time Blocking
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Time Blocking.

hook.text: Cal Newport blocks every minute of his workday on paper. Nothing is left to chance or impulse.

buildup.text: Time blocking assigns specific tasks to fixed calendar slots. It turns intentions into commitments.

discovery.text: Research shows that scheduled tasks are far more likely to be completed than open-ended ones.

twist.text: Critics argue rigid blocks cause stress when interruptions hit. Flexibility matters too.

climax.text: The best blockers leave buffer time between blocks. Structure with breathing room beats rigid plans.

punchline.text: Block your time or someone else will.

quiz.question: What is the main benefit of time blocking?
options: It turns intentions into scheduled commitments
It requires no planning at all
